info.title: Google Sheets SDK API
info.description: Single entry-point API for all Google Sheets SDK functions via a wrapper Lambda

post.summary: Validates and refreshes the access token if necessary.
post.description: This function checks the validity of the current access token. If the token is invalid, it attempts to refresh it using the refresh token. The function is useful for maintaining an active session and ensuring API requests have valid authentication.

body.description: Body of the validateAccessToken sls call

isValid.description: Indicates whether the access token is valid

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid input or unable to refresh token

error.description: Error message describing the issue

401.description: Unauthorized - Both access token and refresh token are invalid

error.description: Error message indicating authentication failure
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Refreshes the access token using the refresh token.
post.description: This function uses the refresh token to obtain a new access token. It is an asynchronous operation that returns a promise, which resolves when the access token has been successfully refreshed. This function is essential for maintaining continuous authentication in long-running applications.

body.description: Body of the refreshAccessToken sls call

400.description: Bad request - Invalid refresh token or client error

401.description: Unauthorized - Refresh token expired or invalid

error.example: Internal server error occurred while refreshing token

post.summary: Retrieves values from a specified range in a Google Sheet.
post.description: This function fetches data from a designated range within a Google Sheet. It requires the sheet ID and the A1 notation of the range as input parameters. The function returns a promise that resolves to a two-dimensional array containing the values from the specified range, or an empty array if the range is empty.

body.description: Body of the getValues sls call

items.description: Range object specifying the sheet ID and range

range.description: The A1 notation of the range

schema.description: A two-dimensional array containing the values in the specified range

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request

404.description: Not Found - Sheet or range not found

error.description: Error message indicating that the sheet or range was not found
Error message describing the internal server error

post.summary: Updates values in a specified range of a Google Sheet.
post.description: This function updates the values in a specified range of a Google Sheet with the provided data. It takes an input object containing the range and values to update, along with an optional parameter to specify how the input data should be interpreted. The function returns a promise that resolves to an object containing information about the update operation.

body.description: Body of the updateValues sls call

items.description: An object containing the range and values to update

input.description: UpdateValuesInput - An object containing the range and values to update

range.description: The A1 notation of the range

valueInputOption.description: How the input data should be interpreted

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message indicating insufficient permissions

404.description: Not Found - Sheet or range not found

error.description: Error message indicating the sheet or range was not found
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Appends values to a specified range in a Google Sheet.
post.description: This function appends provided data to a specified range in a Google Sheet. It allows customization of how the input data should be interpreted and inserted. The function returns a promise that resolves to an object containing information about the append operation.

body.description: Body of the appendValues sls call

items.description: Input object containing the range and values to append

range.description: The A1 notation of the range

values.description: The values to be appended (two-dimensional array)

items.description: How the input data should be interpreted
How the input data should be inserted

tableRange.description: The range of the table that was appended to

updatedRows.description: The number of rows that were updated

updatedColumns.description: The number of columns that were updated

updatedCells.description: The number of cells that were updated

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message indicating insufficient permissions

404.description: Not found - Sheet or range not found

error.description: Error message indicating the sheet or range was not found
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Clears values from a specified range in a Google Sheet.
post.description: This function clears all values from a specified range in a Google Sheet. It takes a single input object containing the sheet ID and the range in A1 notation. The function returns a promise that resolves to an object with information about the clear operation.

body.description: Body of the clearValues sls call

items.description: Input object specifying the sheet ID and range

range.description: The A1 notation of the range

clearedRows.description: The number of rows that were cleared

clearedColumns.description: The number of columns that were cleared

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request

403.description: Forbidden - Insufficient permissions to access the sheet

error.description: Error message indicating insufficient permissions

404.description: Not Found - Sheet or range not found

error.description: Error message indicating the sheet or range was not found
Error message describing the internal server error

post.summary: Batch retrieves values from multiple ranges in a Google Sheet.
post.description: This function allows for efficient retrieval of data from multiple ranges within a Google Sheet using a single batch request. It takes a sheet ID and an array of range notations, returning a three-dimensional array containing the values from each specified range. This approach minimizes API calls and improves performance when fetching data from multiple areas of a spreadsheet.

body.description: Body of the batchGetValues sls call

items.description: An array of A1 notations of the ranges to retrieve

schema.description: A three-dimensional array containing the values in the specified ranges

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request

403.description: Forbidden - Insufficient permissions to access the sheet

error.description: Error message indicating insufficient permissions

404.description: Not Found - Sheet or specified ranges not found

error.description: Error message indicating the resource was not found
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Batch updates values in multiple ranges of a Google Sheet.
post.description: This function allows for updating values in multiple specified ranges of a Google Sheet with provided data in a single batch request. It takes the sheet ID, an array of update inputs, and an optional value input option. The function returns a promise that resolves to an array of API responses, each containing information about an update operation in the batch.

body.description: Body of the batchUpdateValues sls call

items.description: The ID of the sheet. This is a required field and should be a valid string.
An array of objects, each containing the range and values to update. This is a required field.

range.description: The A1 notation of the values to update

items.description: How the input data should be interpreted. Defaults to 'USER_ENTERED'.

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet that was updated.

updatedRange.description: The range (in A1 notation) that was updated.

updatedRows.description: The number of rows that were updated.

updatedColumns.description: The number of columns that were updated.

updatedCells.description: The number of cells that were updated.

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request

403.description: Forbidden - Insufficient permissions to access the sheet

error.description: Error message indicating insufficient permissions

404.description: Not Found - Sheet ID not found

error.description: Error message indicating the sheet was not found
Error message describing the server-side issue

post.summary: Batch clears values from multiple ranges in a Google Sheet.
post.description: This function clears all values from multiple specified ranges in a Google Sheet using a single batch request. It takes the sheet ID and an array of A1 notations for the ranges to be cleared, and returns a promise that resolves to an object containing information about the clear operation.

body.description: Body of the batchClearValues sls call

items.description: The ID of the sheet. This is a required field and should be a valid string.
An array of A1 notations of the ranges to clear. This is a required field and should be an array of valid strings.

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet that was modified

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request

403.description: Forbidden - Insufficient permissions to access the sheet

error.description: Error message indicating insufficient permissions

404.description: Not Found - Sheet or specified ranges not found

error.description: Error message indicating the sheet or ranges were not found
Error message describing the internal server error

post.summary: Detects fully duplicated rows within a specified sheet range.
post.description: This function identifies and returns fully duplicated rows from a given range in a spreadsheet. It takes a single parameter object containing the sheet ID and the range to check, and returns a Promise that resolves to an array of duplicate rows. This can be useful for data cleaning and analysis tasks in spreadsheet applications.

body.description: Body of the duplicateRowsDetection sls call

items.description: Configuration object containing sheet ID and range

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet to check for duplicates

range.description: The range to check for duplicates (e.g., 'A1:B10')

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request

404.description: Not found - sheet or range not found

error.description: Error message indicating that the sheet or range was not found
Error message describing the internal server error

post.summary: Sanitizes sheet data by removing whitespace padding from string cells in a specified range.
post.description: This function removes whitespace padding from all string cells within a given range in a Google Sheet and updates the sheet with the cleaned data. It takes an input object containing the range and values to be sanitized, processes the data, and then updates the sheet using the Google Sheets API.

body.description: Body of the sanitizeSheetData sls call

items.description: The input object containing the range and values to clean and update.

range.description: The range in the sheet to be updated.

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet to be updated.

range.description: The A1 notation of the range to be updated.

values.description: The 2D array of values to be sanitized and updated in the sheet.

200.description: Successfully sanitized and updated the sheet data.

schema.description: The update result from Google Sheets API.

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet that was updated.

updatedRange.description: The range that was updated in A1 notation.

updatedRows.description: The number of rows that were updated.

updatedColumns.description: The number of columns that were updated.

updatedCells.description: The number of cells that were updated.

400.description: Bad request. This could occur if the input parameters are invalid or missing.

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request.

403.description: Forbidden. The request is not authorized to access the sheet.

error.description: Error message indicating lack of permission.

404.description: Not found. The specified sheet or range does not exist.

error.description: Error message indicating the resource was not found.

500.description: Internal server error. An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

error.description: Error message describing the internal server error.
